title: FIA 2024 - Day 5
summary: ESA's stand at the Farnborough International Airshow 2024

title: Space Team Europe for Ariane 6: Ambra Pedrazzini
summary: After taking an astronomy class in school, Ambra Pedrazzini now works for Arianespace on Europe’s newest rocket, Ariane 6. With past experience on Ariane 5, Ambra is now Fluid and Mechanical Interfaces Functional Assistant for the Ariane 6 upper liquid propulsion module.

title: Rocket Report: ABL loses its second booster; Falcon 9 cleared for return to flight
Hubble Images a Classic Spiral
summary: This NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image treats viewers to a wonderfully detailed snapshot of the spiral galaxy NGC 3430 that lies 100 million light-years from Earth in the constellation Leo Minor. Several other galaxies, located relatively nearby to this one, are just beyond the frame of this image; one is close enough that gravitational interaction […]

title: More thruster tests for Starliner before return
summary: NASA and Boeing will fire thrusters on the CST-100 Starliner spacecraft docked to the International Space Station this weekend in what may be a final test before approving the spacecraft’s delayed return to Earth.

title: Earth from Space: Paris in focus
summary: This striking high-resolution image offers an in-depth view of central Paris, allowing you to explore and zoom into the city’s most captivating areas in exceptional detail.

title: Falcon 9 cleared to resume launches
summary: SpaceX is ready to resume launches of its Falcon 9 rocket as soon as July 27 after completing an investigation into an upper stage anomaly two weeks earlier.

title: U.S. military urged to embrace smallsat revolution
summary: Mitchell Institute report: Now is the time for the United States to fully leverage the unique attributes of small satellites

title: Starliner Tests Still Underway, No Date for Butch and Suni’s Return
summary: NASA and Boeing provided an update on the Starliner Crew Flight Test today. They are still conducting tests to determine why the Starliner commercial crew capsule experienced thruster failures and […]

title: Make-or-break tests on tap for Boeing’s Starliner capsule
summary: Critical tests are on tap this weekend to confirm Boeing's Starliner capsule can safety carry its two-person crew back to Earth despite unexpected helium leaks and degraded maneuvering thrusters, officials said Thursday.
